tourist_spots.name: Hazaribagh Wildlife Sanctuary
criticisms: Best wildlife sightings require early starts
tourist_spots.ideal_group_size: Small groups, families, solo nature travellers

tourist_spots.name: Surajkund Hot Spring
tourist_spots.best_time_to_visit: Winter (for warm spring baths) and post-monsoon
criticisms: Water sometimes considered unhygienic for bathing

restaurants.name: Hotel Nandgaon & Highway Delight (Veg)
highlights: Good for groups preferring vegetarian only

tourist_spots.name: Karamdaha Temple & Waterfall
tourist_spots.best_time_to_visit: Monsoon to post-monsoon; Oct–Mar for comfortable weather
criticisms: Access may be rough in bad weather

restaurants.name: Birbhum Hotel
highlights: Known for mutton rice and local non-veg dishes

tourist_spots.name: Panchghagh Falls
tourist_spots.best_time_to_visit: Monsoon to Oct (falls in full flow); Oct–Feb comfortable
criticisms: Can be slippery; access may be uneven

tourist_spots.name: Birsa Mrig Vihar (Deer Park)
criticisms: Limited collection compared to big zoos

hotels.name: Mid-range Lodge (near Ranchi/Khunti)
hotels.location: Near Ranchi outskirts (ideal base for Khunti)

tourist_spots.name: Koderma Reserve Forest / Local Waterfalls
tourist_spots.best_time_to_visit: Monsoon for waterfalls; Oct–Mar for pleasant weather

restaurants.name: Local Dhaba / Hotel Restaurants (Koderma town)
criticisms: Limited variety for travellers used to metropolitan cuisine

tourist_spots.name: Netarhat (Magnolia Point / Koel View / Pine forests)
tourist_spots.entry_fee: Free (some points may have parking fees)
tourist_spots.timings: Sunrise & sunset times best; day visits also good
tourist_spots.best_time_to_visit: Oct–Mar for clear skies; monsoon for greenery & waterfalls

tourist_spots.name: Lodh (Lower Ghaghri) Falls
tourist_spots.entry_fee: Free / nominal entry to forest areas
highlights: Tall waterfall (one of Jharkhand's notable falls)

tourist_spots.name: Betla National Park (nearby / Palamau region)
tourist_spots.timings: Safari timings vary; early morning safaris best
highlights: Historic Palamu fort & local culture nearby
criticisms: Safari slots limited; booking needed in season

hotels.name: Government Tourist Rest Houses / Basic Lodges (Netarhat)

bokaro_tourist_spots.name: Shree Ayyappa Temple
bokaro_tourist_spots.ideal_group_size: Solo travelers, small families, senior citizens

bokaro_tourist_spots.name: City Park
highlights: Venue for festivals like Basant Mela and Chhatth Puja
bokaro_tourist_spots.budget: Low (Free entry, optional food and ride costs)

bokaro_tourist_spots.name: Jagannath Temple
criticisms: Temple pond could be better maintained

chatra_tourist_spots.name: Dhankund Waterfall
highlights: Ideal for forest walks and photography

chatra_tourist_spots.name: Kunda Cave
chatra_tourist_spots.ideal_group_size: Solo travelers, spiritual seekers, small groups

chatra_tourist_spots.name: Bheem Barrage
highlights: Ideal for birdwatching and sunset views

chatra_tourist_spots.name: Mahadev Dham (Itkhori)
highlights: Blend of Buddhist and Hindu architecture

deoghar_tourist_spots.name: Baba Baidyanath Temple
criticisms: Some priests charge higher rates for rituals

deoghar_tourist_spots.name: Basukinath Temple
highlights: Peaceful temple complex with surrounding shrines
Blissful darshan and direct offerings to deity

deoghar_tourist_spots.name: Trikuta Parvata
highlights: Vertically ascending ropeway for exceptional views
Hanuman temple at summit with historical significance
Panoramic hill vistas and trekking options
criticisms: Not suitable for elderly or height-phobic

deoghar_tourist_spots.name: Nandan Pahar
highlights: Toy train ride and evening food stalls

dhanbad_tourist_spots.name: Maithon Dam
dhanbad_tourist_spots.location: Maithon, ~52 km from Dhanbad HQ, on the Barakar River
highlights: Largest reservoir of Damodar Valley with an underground power station
Boating, gardens, viewpoints, and nearby Kalyaneshwari Temple
criticisms: Weekend crowds; variable cleanliness near ghats

dhanbad_tourist_spots.name: Panchet Dam
dhanbad_tourist_spots.location: Panchet, Dhanbad district, on Damodar River
highlights: Lush hills and forests around the dam
Day-trip spot for boating and picnics

dhanbad_tourist_spots.name: Bhatinda Falls
dhanbad_tourist_spots.location: Moonidih area, ~14 km from Dhanbad Railway Station

dhanbad_tourist_spots.name: Topchanchi Lake & Wildlife Sanctuary
highlights: Serene lake with birdlife and surrounding hills
criticisms: Facilities vary; seasonal crowding on holidays

dhanbad_tourist_spots.name: Shakti Mandir
highlights: Prominent temple of Goddess Durga in the city

dhanbad_tourist_spots.name: Birsa Munda Park
highlights: Large city park with rides and lawns
Suitable for kids and relaxed walks

dhanbad_tourist_spots.name: Lillori Sthan Mandir
highlights: Historic Shiva temple and local pilgrimage site

dhanbad_tourist_spots.name: Jharia Coalfields (viewpoints and guided visits nearby)
highlights: Insight into India’s coal capital and mining history
Unique industrial landscapes and educational tours
criticisms: Restricted access in active/fire zones; safety protocols essential

dumka_tourist_spots.name: Masanjore Dam (Canada/Palpala Dam)
dumka_tourist_spots.location: Masanjore village, ~31 km south of Dumka HQ, Jharkhand
highlights: Picturesque dam on the Mayurakshi River bounded by forested hills
Popular picnic spot with gardens and viewpoints
Heritage hydel project with nearby Dak bungalows
criticisms: Can get crowded on weekends and holidays
dumka_tourist_spots.budget: Low to moderate (transport, food, optional boating)

dumka_tourist_spots.name: Baba Basukinath Dham
dumka_tourist_spots.location: Jarmundi Block, ~24–25 km from Dumka HQ, Jharkhand
highlights: Major Shiva temple and pilgrimage center on the Dumka–Deoghar corridor
Large seasonal fairs with devotees from across India
criticisms: Heavy crowds and long queues during Shravan and Shivratri

dumka_tourist_spots.name: Malooti (Maluti Temples)
dumka_tourist_spots.location: Shikaripara Block, ~55 km from Dumka HQ, Jharkhand
highlights: Historic terracotta temple village with dozens of shrines
Blend of archaeology, art, and religious heritage
criticisms: Some structures need conservation; limited signage

dumka_tourist_spots.name: Tatloi Hot Spring
dumka_tourist_spots.location: Tatloi, ~15 km from Dumka HQ, Jharkhand
highlights: Natural hot water spring in a green, hilly setting
criticisms: Limited facilities; seasonal access issues in rains

dumka_tourist_spots.name: Naag Mandir, Shiv Pahar
highlights: Temple atop Shiv Pahar hill with multiple shrines
Local spiritual landmark with city views
criticisms: Steps can be steep for seniors

dumka_tourist_spots.name: Baba Sumeshwar Nath Temple
dumka_tourist_spots.location: Saraiyahat Block, ~60 km from Dumka HQ, Jharkhand
highlights: Prominent Shiva temple with local fairs

dumka_tourist_spots.name: Mayurakshi River (Dumka stretch)
highlights: Major river originating at Trikut Hill, feeding Masanjore Dam
Scenic riverbank spots for walks and photos

dumka_tourist_spots.name: Shristi Hill Park
criticisms: Basic amenities; can be busy on weekends

east_singhbhum_tourist_spots.name: Jubilee Park
highlights: Ideal for family outings and picnics
east_singhbhum_tourist_spots.budget: Low (Free entry, optional food and rides)
east_singhbhum_tourist_spots.ideal_group_size: Families, groups of friends, joggers, cyclists

east_singhbhum_tourist_spots.name: Russi Modi Centre of Excellence
highlights: Tribute to Russi Modi, legendary industrialist

east_singhbhum_tourist_spots.name: Dalma Wildlife Sanctuary
highlights: Spread over 193 sq. km. forest area
Popular for trekking and nature trails
east_singhbhum_tourist_spots.ideal_group_size: Friends, families, wildlife enthusiasts, trekking groups

east_singhbhum_tourist_spots.name: Tata Steel Zoological Park
east_singhbhum_tourist_spots.location: Marine Drive Road, near XLRI, Jubilee Park, Jamshedpur, Jharkhand
highlights: Easy access from Tatanagar Junction (0.78 km)

garhwa_tourist_spots.name: Jharkhandi Dham
highlights: Blend of cultural heritage and natural beauty

giridih_tourist_spots.name: Parasnath Hill
highlights: Ideal for trekking and cultural exploration
criticisms: Trek can be challenging for elderly visitors

giridih_tourist_spots.name: Usri Falls
giridih_tourist_spots.budget: Low (Free entry, food and travel costs)

giridih_tourist_spots.name: Rajrappa Temple
highlights: Known for unique rituals and traditions
criticisms: Can get very crowded during festivals

giridih_tourist_spots.name: Dhanbad
highlights: Known as the Coal Capital of India
criticisms: Pollution and traffic in the city

godda_tourist_spots.name: Godda Dam
highlights: Beautiful views of dam and surroundings
Ideal for picnics, fishing, and boating
godda_tourist_spots.budget: Low to moderate (travel, food, optional boating)

godda_tourist_spots.name: Chintamani Temple
highlights: One of the most beautiful temples in Godda

godda_tourist_spots.name: Sono Falls
criticisms: Accessibility may be difficult during monsoon

gumla_tourist_spots.name: Palkot Wildlife Sanctuary
highlights: Home to tigers, leopards, elephants, and deer
criticisms: Accessibility may be difficult during rains

gumla_tourist_spots.name: Birsa Zoological Park
highlights: Home to tigers, lions, elephants, and birds
